Reviews.Content: Cute place with a great view       view from our hotel room
Reviews.Author: waterangel21

Reviews.Content: Perfect location We booked via lastminute.com and paid an excellent rate for a huge room overlooking the arno. Staff were friendly and it was superb to have such a central location. Having lived in Florence in the road behind this hotel and having visited many times over the years, I can honestly say this was the best value for money and the ideal hotel to stay in with regards to the location.The breakfast is basic and the communal rooms in dire need of attention. The lift was not working either. However, the room was large and the bathroom too. The bed was hard but we slept like logs. I just hope we can get a similar bargain when the renovation works are completed. Somehow I doubt it!
Reviews.Author: Eldridge495

Reviews.Content: Excellent! We got a fantastic room with a marvelous view at the ponte vecchio! Big beautiful room with a large bed and jacuzzi! Good breakfast, nice staff, especially the owner! Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: toscane8

Reviews.Content: Great View of the Arno The afternoon and evening hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We got a newly renovated room that was very spacious with an amazing view of the Arno. It really helped that we visited off season because the room rate was remarkable. The bathroom was very spacious and cleaned daily, it was nice to have both a shower with good shower head pressure and a jetbath. Breakfast was an average continental breakfast that was good for getting us started with something in the morning.The hotel is in such a great location. Florence is a very compact city, we walked from the train station with our backpacks and found it easily within 15 minutes. The Ponte Vecchio is about 10 minutes walk down the road and if you cross to the other side of the Arno there is a grocery store and an internet cafe.A few negatives:-the elevator wasn't working because of renovations, have to walk about 2-3 flights to get to room. (yet we are a young couple so it was not a big deal.)-there was no phone or clock (so we could not do a wake up call or set an alarm). -the bed was rock hard, which we never got use to in our 3 night stay.-the smell that other reviewers were talking about did exist when we walked into the building but it was not present in our rooms thank goodness.-the light/window fixtures in the room looked like they were about to fall off, and one actually was off already.
Reviews.Author: jv_blues

Reviews.Content: Split Decision Great and Avg The location is superb. The service was top notch. Our party stayed in one triple and one double. The double was recently renovated and excellent in all furnishings and design. The triple was average and had difficulty with enough hot water and water pressure. We arrived later in the evening and found the gentleman at the front desk most helpful with our car (parking is a big issue in Florence) our multiple bags and tips on the area. We would all stay at this hotel again. We were in very close proximity to all we wanted to see and do. We had the garage come and pick up our car upon check in and did not need it again until our departure. Internet was available in the lounge area. Breakfast was excellent.
Reviews.Author: zeckster

Reviews.Content: Great locations, average room This hotel sits in a great location on the bank of the Arno river within view of the Ponte Vecchio. All the highlights are at walking distance. The room was smallish and the bathroom smelled a bit mouldy. However, good value for the money! Breakfast was quite nice.
Reviews.Author: nboker

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel! This hotel is right on the river and the rooms are great! Again, very basic for a typical American hotel, but I was impressed after learning what the typical European hotels are like. There is a nice breakfast in the morning - not your typical eggs and ham, but you get a nice, hot croissant and a selection of cheese, ham and cereal with your juice (typical of the hotels we stayed in). The bathroom was of average size, not tiny at all, and very comfortable. Our double had a room with a small balcony, which was nice. The best part of the hotel is the entry way and the adjoining rooms - they are beautiful. I believe the hotel is a renovated old palace, so take note of the chandeliers and frescoes on the wall. The staff recommended a place for us to eat: The Gallery - it is incredible! check it out when you get there, a nice woman is the chef there and we couldn't have enjoyed our food more, and the prices were not bad at all.
Reviews.Author: KEKNewYork

Reviews.Content: Mixed review       Renovated Room - 38
Reviews.Author: chad2001

Reviews.Content: Friendly, convenient, romantic To be in Florance means to be in romance and in art history. Hotel Bretagna is the right place.You are in the middle of the old city, on Arno River, you can walk almost every where including central train station.Hotel building is a part of history with frescoes. You will enjoy having your cafe in a part of a palace, and your breakfast in a Baroc Salon Prices are very reasonable, very friendly personal.But if you are a Luxury type please choose another hotel.Akin S眉rmeliGermany / Turkey
Reviews.Author: AkinSurmeli

Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by first impression There's still a fair bit of refurbishments going on so there was scaffolding on the outside so it wasn't easy to find. Also, it looked quite shabby on the inside of the building and the Reception looked tired too and at first I was on the verge of saying I'd made a mistake. However, we booked a superior room and they're the refurbished ones and they're absolutely fine. Very clean and spacious. The hotel is full of old world charm - it is rather surreal as it is like stepping back in time with its painted ceilings, chandeliers etc - and I think some people would consider it a bit too tired decor wise. Also, whilst it is a hotel it doesn't really have hotel service - staying there is a bit like renting a room for a couple of days in an grand old house. On the whole though it was a very interesting experience. The staff were wonderful, hugely helpful. The location simply cannot be faulted. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to spend a couple of days in Florence.
Reviews.Author: SLD64

Reviews.Content: Brilliant for a 1* hotel       View towards entrance of room
Reviews.Author: Mark_EFC_1878

Reviews.Content: Price is Right, Construction is Not Hotel (Pensione) Bretagna is in a great location right in the Arno River and 15 minutes or less from the major sights. The staff was very helpful in pointing out things like grocery stores, laundry mat, and internet cafes. While we were staying there the hotel was under renovation and starting at about 8 AM there were drills and jackhammers that woke us up (on the upside no alarm clock needed). I believe this is why it was so cheap for our double room with shared bathroom (30 Euro). The rooms were a bit small but for the price who is complaining? The building is very large and I think it used to be a large manor Palace of some sort. They offer breakfast which you have to pay for but I always just got a pastry from a local cafe insteadThe shared shower had good pressure and heat. Our room also had a sink. Overall this is good place for a base in Florence/Tuscany but I would not recommend it for people who are looking for a room with lots of extra comforts.
Reviews.Author: 3monthsineurope

Reviews.Content: very atmospheric Hotel Bretagna is amazing, its like stepping into another century but in a nice way! It is very handy for the main station and is a only a few minutes walk from the centre of town. Florence is a beautiful city and if you like old buildings and are an art lover its a city you must visit. I would recommend booking a ' superior bedroom' at the hotel as they are in the process of renovating the hotel and these rooms have been refurbished and are very nice. The first couple of nights we were put into a lovely room with a fantastic whirlpool bath and a view of the Ponte Veccio, this was done at no extra charge as I fancied a bath. We were then moved to another equally nice room with a power shower but unfortunately no bath. The only thing I would say is that my partner and I found the beds exceptionally hard, so if you like a soft bed this place is not for you!The staff were friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast was fine, again if you like a full English breakfast this hotel would not suit you. On the whole everything was very good (apart from the bed) and I would certainly recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: historyloverGlasgow

Reviews.Content: Terrible experience, left in 30 minutes. Granted, I selected the cheaper room, but this place was disgusting. Charm is not the word. My hall had 10 rooms sharing 1 retrofitted bathroom that is smaller than my closet. I flushed the toilet, and water bubbled out of the sink. My room also had very little heat, smelled, and there were stains on the bedspread. The room was also poorly retrofitted for electricity and would not have come close to passing code in the US. In 30 minutes, I packed up and left for any new lodging along the street. I landed at Hotel degli Orafi, which was magnificent.
Reviews.Author: Soundrr73

Reviews.Content: Recommended The hotel is in a good location on the river front, giving you lovely views of the Arno and the Ponte Vecchio. Everything you want to see is within walking distance, as are a great number of good restaurants  shops. The hotel is within part of an old palace  is a beautiful historic building. The part we stayed in had been recently refurbished to a good standard, the room was spacious, clean  comfy. As it was November it did get a bit chilly but we were fine once we'd worked out the heating unit  with extra blankets. Staff were v friendly  helpful. Breakfast was good, lots of choice. The only problem we had was with hot water, which was a bit unpredictable, other than that an excellent place to stay  v good value.
Reviews.Author: laab

Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, antique, cozy.. location, location, location!! My husband and I stayed at the Bretagna from Nov 12-15th in room 40 for 65 euro/night (it was low season). There are both renovated and unrenovated rooms iin the Bretagna. We were first placed in room 14 at check-in, but it was tiny, had no view, and no character. We had 3 suitcases with us and needed more space, so I requested a larger room. If I were you, I would request to see which rooms are available.. There are many beautiful, renovated rooms and it will make a big difference in your vacation. We ended up in room 40, which was perfect. A view of the Arno, a jacuzzi bath, marble bathroom, a double and a twin bed, nicely heated. Also, ask for a tour of the rooms closed to the public, under renovation... this used to be a mansion used by a king, and it is pretty amazing! Almost better than going to the Uffizi, I really enjoyed seeing the place as it was hundreds of years ago. The location is perfect... We enjoyed the area south of the Arno almost as much as the center of florence/duomo area. It was really nice to be close to both! And only 1.5 blocks to the Ponte Vecchio. You can't beat it at this price. The breakfast was sufficient, crossiants, ham, nutella, jam, coffee, tea, cereal, etc... you will be eating a lot in Florence and breakfast should be the one place you try to cut back!! The front desk scheduled our reservations at the Uffizi and Accademia galleries through email which was great.. didn't have to wait in line.
Reviews.Author: laragrey

Reviews.Content: Pretty but too noisy and old Hotel Bretagna was beautiful. We had a huge room with a comfortable bed. There was big modern bathroom with a nice big shower and we had giant fresco of cherubs on our ceiling...very romantic. The building is situated right on the Arno River right by the Ponte Vecchio. Great location for walking to and from the sights of Florence. Breakfast was served every morning in a large pretty dining room where they had soothing jazz playing. A very nice touch. However, they were renovating the building and put us in a room that should have never been rented. It was right next to the room they were working on and we were forced to wake up to drilling and sawing at 8:00 each morning. When I came home to take a nap one day at 4:00, it was still going on and I couldn't sleep. When we complained, they told us that they would ask the workers to hold off until 9:30 am to start working and the next morning they were at it again at 8. Not sun and very frustrating if you are on vacation looking for peace and relaxation. The hotel advertised that there was a TV in the room and there was but it did not work at all. When we said something to the man at the front desk, he gave us attitude and said, well we say that you get a TV but we don't guarantee the TV works. Do not leave valuables in the room because the room is not secure and the windows are so old, they do not lock properly. We were planning on staying for 3 nights and decided to leave after 2 because we had had it. The should have given us a night's stay free of charge for all the hassle but instead they only gave us 30 Euros off.
Reviews.Author: greek_geek

Reviews.Content: Cozy and Comfortable       Room 6
Reviews.Author: justbreathe24

Reviews.Content: fantastica hotel location one of best in world - rooms elegant, well-furnished and clean - facilities good and being upgraded - staff very intelligent, friendly and helpful - amazing value for a delightful holiday
Reviews.Author: paul1Burnley

Reviews.Content: Great budget hotel, Great Location This is a real Tuscan gem. The entrance and lobby area was slightly off putting. The building was covered in scaffolding and there were ladders and buckets of paint everywhere. The lobby was located on the second floor and once we reached it, it was more reassuring! It has a very quaint 1930s bohemian feel to it with large high ceiliangs and faces right on to the River Arno, right beside the Ponte Vechia. Our room, no 35, was lovely. It had been recently refurbished, huge high ceilings and had a river view. There was a jacuzzi bath in the bathroom, the shower had a leak however.The main problems: the rude receptionist, she spent the whole checking-in time talking down to us, telling us what we couldnt do, it was very school mistress-ish. She was also very reluctant to telephone a restaurant that we had booked to confirm the reservation. That aside, the air conditioning made a dreadful noise, and as a light sleeper it really bothered me. The breakfast was poor also. They also insisted that we paid for the 4 nights the day before we checked out, which I did but my boyfriend felt that it was very strange! The lift is tiny, no room for much luggage!But the hotel has a lovely quaint feel to it, it is in a lovely location, very reasonably priced and once fully renovated should be really beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Avidtravelleruthie

Reviews.Content: Very special hotel We enjoyed our stay in Hotel Bretagna very much, it is next to Ponte Vecchio at the river Arno. Having breakfast in an ancient palazzo-room, being welcomed by a very friendly staff we decided for always booking this hotel again when we go to Florence.
Reviews.Author: Karlavalentina

Reviews.Content: Budget hotel with good location We stayed at this very central hotel for a couple of nights in Florence. In all we were reasonably satisfied with our stay despite a couple of hiccups. However, on our return to Holland we found that we had been mysteriously registered with TripAdvisor and allegedly gave a glowing review of Hotel Bretagna although of course we have not confirmed this as our review. This can only have come from the hotel itself which seems rather aggressive marketing and the review itself was ridiculously self-congratulatory. The staff were helpful but also very stressed out and we witnessed on a couple of occasions problems where other guests had a lost booking or were not satisfied. The hotel was obviously once gorgeous but its heyday is long over and although our room was fine the shared bathroom we had could have done with some better plumbing and overall makeover. If you want to stay in central Florence I would certainly recommend this place but don't expect too much from this hotel which is definitely on the budget side.
Reviews.Author: rietmeijer

Reviews.Content: A special experience My mom actually lived in this pensione when she lived in Florence for a year during college, so when she and I took a trip to Italy together, we had to stay here. And we're glad we did. Although it's changed quite a bit since she lived there, it's still got fond memories, and the remodels are underway and looking to be quite impressive. Our room was spacious and clean, with a view of the river and the Ponte Vecchio, and we were delighted by the size of the bathroom and the presence of a bathtub!!! The staff was immensely friendly, and were eager to chat with Mom about the history of the building. Can't wait to go back when everything is finished!
Reviews.Author: ktlove15

Reviews.Content: Great staff. location, and rates My partner and I stayed for 5 nights the last week of May. The location on the Arno with a balcony in the reception area that could be used at any time during the day was lovely. The staff were outstanding: helpful with recommendations, friendly, and responsive. We came to know Vera and Martina by name by the end of the second day. A computer at the desk was made available to guests at no charge for checking email. Breakfasts were in a charming dining area and the food was fresh each morning. If you need a pizza later in the evening the front desk can make a great recommendation that will be readily delivered. Everything was within an easy walking distance. Rooms varied according to age; ours was comfortable. We explored some of the renovation being done on the top floor and found what will likely be 5 star rooms. Although we did not stay out past 9 or 10 p.m. the area seemed very safe. The train station is a modest walk, a little too far on foot with extra luggage. When we left we think we made a mistake and did not get in the taxi that had been called. This driver turned a short, early Sunday morning trip into a major expense! BE sure to notice the number on the taxi and wait for the one that had been ordered. We learned our lesson. We would gladly stay here on a future visit.
Reviews.Author: HappyGuestBerkeley

Reviews.Content: Good Location, Friendly Staff Hotel Bretagna is actualy a Pensione. The hotel is undergoing renovation. Although dealing with the construction was slightly inconvenient, it was easy to see that when the renovation is completed, the hotel will be much improved and comfortable. Even though the older room that my 20-year old son and friend had was dark, it was roomier than a place we stayed in Rome, and cost significantly less. I had the pleasure of staying in one of the new rooms, which was clean, comfortable, and had a view of the Arno, Ponte Vecchio, and Oltrarno district. The new bed was extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly, helpful, and made excellent suggestions for dinner and sight-seeing. It is conveniently located for centtral Florence. The small dining room is cozy, the breakfast was satisfying, and the coffee was delicious. For the price, it is a 'find' and I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: LovinItaly07

Reviews.Content: Ripped Off and Lied To I went to this hotel because of its location and was given a single room at the bargain rate of 105 Euro per night. I was told it had air conditioning as well as someone at the door in the evenings. The air conditioning was broken and there was no one manning the entrance to the building late at night. The manager was worthless as she neither rectified problems nor felt a need to apologize for anything. As a single woman, I did not feel safe there. The hallways were pitch black and unless you know where the light switches are, you will stumble as I did through this ugly maze of construction. The room was frumpy and neither the bedspread nor the carpet was clean. Each morning I came down to a breakfast room that had tables of dirty dishes that were not cleared because the hotel has only one girl doing serving all the guests and it is more than she can keep up with. I spoke with other guests and found out I was paying 35 Euro more a night than they were. If you MUST stay here, and I hope you have other options, ask to see the room first and try the air conditioner if you are there during the summer.
Reviews.Author: LovesEurope5

Reviews.Content: lovely 4 day break Our short break was lovely.We stayed in a double room with ensuit,slightly small but very clean.Breakfast was in the gold guilded room wwhich was fantastic.The balconey which led off from the reception had the most stunning views of the Arno river and the ponte vecchio.The staff were all friiendly,helpful and fun,and certainly made our stay enjoyable.
Reviews.Author: wflipflop

Reviews.Content: Good location but poor rooms Well, Florence is known to be quite expensive when it comes to hotels, so we were happy to get a 45鈧?double including continental breakfast on an off-season-weekend. The breakfast is served in a beautiful room overlooking the Arno River (you might even see Ponte Vecchio) and consists of a small roll, coffee/tea, yoghurt, butter, jam, honey and some packed croissants and rusks- fairly OK I麓d say. Staff was friendly and helpful, but the rooms are the big downside of the property. Not so much is it the elevator bringing you to the rooms and strictly restricted to 2 people. As soon as you step out of it, you are in the middle of a building site, step through a small door and then walk to your room. You will find it to be pretty spartan, but with a telly, our room had a private bathroom across the floor, but the toilet was missing the cover, so we were given another next door. In terms of cleanliness the room as average, but the bathroom was poor. The hotel was good for a short weekend trip in January, but I wouldn麓t stay there in the heat of the Italian summer, even though it had airco. Nevertheless the location is perfect, you step out and are on the banks of the river, a mere 300m from the Ponte Vecchio and only few minutes form all other sights.
Reviews.Author: zolagola

Reviews.Content: Don't leave home for this dump If you go to Florence, don't stay here unless you are very cheap and care little for hygiene. The pensione is run down, but more than that, no effort by the owners/management was made to make it inviting. The public areas have old furniture that one doesn't want to sit on, and the bathrooms are not clean. We rented two rooms. One was a single with a private bathroom, but the bathroom had a very strange odor and the room not nice. The double room was an ugly green, dusty, with windows and shutters that were broken. All night long the Vespas, ambulances, trucks, cars, and voices made sleeping impossible. Although we requested two singles, we were told that there was no staff and if we wanted to separate the beds and make the beds ourselves we could. We were given two small washclothes, but no towels, soap, or shampoo. The bathroom that we had to use was not clean. Truly, not even students should stay here! If this is the last hotel available in Florence, stay home.
Reviews.Author: Sincerelyput

Reviews.Content: Fantastic balcony This hotel is apparently about to be redone, according to one of the desk clerks. It is a little shabby but absolutely delightful. All the staff were helpful and friendly, the lobby area and breakfast area were great spaces though they were a bit worn. We loved the little balcony off the lobby that overlooked the Arno. What a fantastic view! Bath was across the hall from our room and smelled a little musty but facilities were clean and you couldn't beat this location.
Reviews.Author: ijan

Reviews.Content: Website is very misleading I just got back from a trip to Italy and I want to warn any travelers who might be considering the Hotel Bretagna in Florence. I studied in Italy and travel there frequently. I have an Italian friend who owns a BB and I assured him that I could make the hotel reservations for Florence because I know the city well. I found the Hotel Bretagna's website and thought I had found a gem. It is right along the Arno and the photos were beautiful. I booked a double room and asked many questions. I know what to expect from Italian hotels and I know that they are very different than a Holiday Inn. I did not have unrealistic expectations.When we arrived I was horrified at the condition of the entrance and reception area. It was filthy and very run-down. I didn't know what to think, I decided to see the room before complaining. The room was also filthy. The bathroom was dirty and the room was extremely shabby. It was like a flea-bag hotel you would find near the train station. The bed linens were threadbear, musty and visibly dirty.I was embarrassed that I had chosen so poorly, especially since my friend is the proprietor of a BB. We complained about how dirty and run-down everything was and I said I wouldn't stay. Luckily, I found an alternate hotel that was fine but the Bretagna still charged my credit card for one night's stay.I am not a picky traveler. I travel on a budget all the time, I usually opt for a shared bathroom just to share a few dollars. But this place was terrible and compared to the way it was presented on the website, it was inexcusable. My Italian friend summed it up when he told the front desk My compliments to the photographer!I'd hate to see someone be as disappointed as we were. I thought we would have a beautiful, tranquil and romantic stay and we wasted half a day just getting relocated. If I didn't know Florence so well, we might have had to stay there and I actually thought they might have bed-bugs. I wouldn't advise this hotel to anyone.
Reviews.Author: camiller

Reviews.Content: Good Location, Bathroom Stank The location is excellent, right on the Arno River with great views of Florence. Just a few blocks from the Uffuzi Gallery and main center. Didn't get the best impression upon check-in. It was about 11 pm, and they had all the lights off in the main lobby. Then, when we got to our room, 2 light bulbs were out, and they didn't have replacements (it worked out though, because we found the other light switches for the remaining lights). The good thing is that there is a large (new) sink in your room, that cuts your reliance on the communal restroom. The restroom (shower, toilet) is down the hall, and really stinks - an unfresh odor, you can't put your finger on. I suppose you can adapt to it during a quick shower. At one point, there wasn't enough toilet paper... Also, when you flushed the toilet, water bubbles up from the sink - just go to your room and wash your hands. The breakfast (included) was good though - table service they serve you fresh cafe, bread and juice. I loved the nutella packets to go with the bread - yum! It's true like their website says, the dining room looks out on the river and has spectacular views.
Reviews.Author: suluu

Reviews.Content: such a great place   showReview(4346640, 'full');
